title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1601.1 - Organization
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1601.1 - Organization

State Regulations
(a) Selection of
members of an authority. (1)

The mayor or
other chief executive of a municipality shall file with the commissioner a
certificate of appointment of reappointment of any member of an authority. No
such appointment or reappointment shall be effective until such certificate has
been filed. (Public Housing Law, §30, subd. 2.)
(2)

Two tenant members elected by the
residents, may be included in authorities having supervision over 100 or more
dwelling units and not located in a city having a popluation of more than one
million. (Public Housing Law, §30, subd. 5)
(b) By-laws, rules and regulations of an
authority. (1)

An authority shall file with
the commissioner a copy of any by-laws, rules and regulations and amendments
thereto adopted by it from time to time. No such by-laws, rules and regulations
and amendments thereto shall be effective until filed with the
commissioner. (2)

All rules and
regulations and amendments thereto adopted by an authority from time to time, except such as relate by its organization or internal management, shall be
filed in the office of the Department of State. (Constitution, art. 4, §
8; Public Housing Law, §54.)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§
1601.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
